results.title: A Little bit of willpower
results.creator_credit: Leanda Bunn, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Kicked out of home at the age of 15 and struggling with depression, Leanda Bunn still managed to complete her VCE, find accommodation and be independent thanks to a few very special people in her life and a lot of willpower.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leanda Bunn, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Kicked out of home at the age of 15 and struggling with depression, Leanda Bunn still managed to complete her VCE, find accommodation and be independent thanks to a few very special people in her life and a lot of willpower.

results.title: In memory of Mark and Dusty
results.creator_credit: Denise Thompson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: It is ten years since the tragic passing of Denise Thompson’s son Mark and the family dog Dusty. A loving tribute by a mother to her son and the pet dog he gave her when he was little.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Denise Thompson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: It is ten years since the tragic passing of Denise Thompson’s son Mark and the family dog Dusty. A loving tribute by a mother to her son and the pet dog he gave her when he was little.

results.title: I spell I can't...I can!
results.creator_credit: Edie Collet, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Edie Collet’s beginnings were difficult - her mother died giving birth and she was diagnosed as being handicapped. Collet was raised by her father and siblings to become an educated, well travelled and independent adult. Collet was told she would never work but she proved them wrong. This story is dedicated to Collet’s dad.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Edie Collet, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Edie Collet’s beginnings were difficult - her mother died giving birth and she was diagnosed as being handicapped. Collet was raised by her father and siblings to become an educated, well travelled and independent adult. Collet was told she would never work but she proved them wrong. This story is dedicated to Collet’s dad.

results.title: Grumpy old man
results.creator_credit: Richard Bailey, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Richard Bailey has nudged and niggled people and he’s had some success, especially on the asbestos issue. A heart attack in 2003 meant that Bailey couldn’t be as active anymore, so he decided to direct his energies elsewhere.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Bailey, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Days of clear water
results.creator_credit: Emma Case, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Emma describes her life growing up with her nan, an independent lady who loved to tend to her garden and go for walks along the river. When her nan passed away, Emma lost not only her nan but her best friend.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Emma Case, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Emma describes her life growing up with her nan, an independent lady who loved to tend to her garden and go for walks along the river. When her nan passed away, Emma lost not only her nan but her best friend.

results.title: Train the trainer : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: Nine members of the general public in Melbourne tell their stories. These stories resonate deeply with the participants and, ultimately, are an expression of the creator’s identity.

results.title: The Will to live
results.creator_credit: Val Colbert, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Fragile at birth and not meant to live, Val Colbert’s mother went the extra step to keep her alive. This story is dedicated to Colbert’s mum’s tenacity and eternal strength.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Val Colbert, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Fragile at birth and not meant to live, Val Colbert’s mother went the extra step to keep her alive. This story is dedicated to Colbert’s mum’s tenacity and eternal strength.

results.title: Uncovering bones
results.creator_credit: Helen Kakakios, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Helen Kakakios started a journey thinking she would do one thing but opened up all sorts of other possibilities and experiences. A story of identity, family and both the joy and pain of a journey home.

results.title: The Luddite's tale
results.creator_credit: Myfanwy Thompson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Myfawny Thompson is perplexed by technology, especially the need to text to communicate. After helping her mother move house, Thomspon starts to realise what a wonderful gift technology can be.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Myfanwy Thompson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Like blood
results.creator_credit: Maya Haviland, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: ‘Petul is my older sister’s godfather and I am the first woman from my family to visit his grave.’ Maya Haviland’s return to Mexico after eight years made her realise the sense of distance between family members.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Maya Haviland, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
